quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Led Zeppelin and Actor
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, zeppelin, crowes. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This American comedian and writer became especially popular after her appearances on The Tonight Show with Johnny Carson. This is one of her jokes:  Waiters and waitresses are becoming nicer and much more caring. I used to pay my check, they would say Thank you. That’s now escalated into You take care of yourself, now. The other day I paid my check and the waiter said, Don’t put off that mammogram.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rita Rudner

questions.question: Who managed rock band Led Zeppelin?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Peter Grant

questions.question: Who produced all of Led Zeppelins albums?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jimmy Page

questions.question: For years this was the theme song to the British music TV show, Tops of the Pops.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Whole Lotta Love

questions.question: The final Led Zep album that featured previously unreleased studio music was titled Coda.  What does Coda mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The end of a song

questions.question: Led Zeppelins final concert took place in 1980, in what country?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: England

questions.question: The author of the following line is a Jewish American stand-up comedian and actor, noted for his grating voice and tendency to shout a lot during performances.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gilbert Gottfried

questions.question: Where was Richard Dreyfus born?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Brooklyn

questions.question: The movie Almost Famous was loosely based on Cameron Crowes adventures as a teenage journalist touring with Led Zeppelin.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Who came up with the name Led Zeppelin?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Keith Moon

questions.question: This American stand-up comedian is an ordained rabbi and is known for his provocative and sometimes abusive language. He delivered the following words:  My grandfather always said, Dont watch your money; watch your health. So one day while I was watching my health, someone stole my money. It was my grandfather.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jackie Mason

questions.question: Which of these great guitarists did not play for The Yardbirds, the band that became Led Zeppelin?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Brian May

questions.question: This American stand-up comedian, actor, and writer has an innocent appearance that is in contrast with her comic material, in which she deals with many controversial topics such as racism, abortion, rape and child abuse. The following line was delivered by her:  “My sister was with two men one night. She could hardly walk after that. Can you imagine? Two dinners!?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sarah Silverman

questions.question: Which artist was not ever a member of Led Zeppelin?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Roger Daltry

questions.question: What the real name of John Paul Jones of Led Zeppelin?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Baldwin

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Richard Dreyfuss and Movie
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, judge, star. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Who played the female leading role in the 1980 movie The Competition?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Amy Irving

questions.question: Who played Jerry Baskin in the movie Down and Out in Beverly Hills?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nick Nolte

questions.question: Who portrayed the Whitemans neighbor in the movie Down and Out in Beverly Hills?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Little Richard

questions.question: Who co-starred with Richard Dreyfuss in a 1977 movie written by Neil Simon?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Marsha Mason

questions.question: What is the decision of Judge Wyler in the movie Whose Life Is It Anyway?, starring Richard Dreyfuss?

options.text: Harrison has the right to demand that his death be induced by injection.
Harrison has no right to have his tubes turned off.
Harrison has no right to demand his own death.
Harrison has the right to have his tubes turned off.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Harrison has the right to have his tubes turned off.

questions.question: In 1980 Richard Dreyfuss played Paul Dietrich in The Competition. What instrument did his character play?

options.text: all of  these - he was a music teacher

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: concert piano

questions.question: In 1995 Richard Dreyfuss starred in Mr. Hollands Opus. In this movie what was true about Mr. Hollands son?

options.text: He was addicted to pain killers.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He was deaf.

questions.question: In the1987 comedy film Tin Men, Richard Dreyfuss plays an aluminum siding salesman. Who plays his competitor?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Danny DeVito

questions.question: Who played Bob in the 1991 film What About Bob?, starring Richard Dreyfuss?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bill Murray

questions.question: In 1986 Richard Dreyfuss appeared in Down and Out in Beverly Hills. Who played his wife in the movie?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bette Midler

questions.question: This Dirty Dancing star died in September of 2009.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Patrick Swayze

questions.question: Which statement regarding Richard Dreyfuss is false?

options.text: Moon Over Parador starring Dreyfuss was not set in Mexico.
Dreyfuss was a conscientious objector during the Vietnam War.
Dreyfuss never appeared in a movie set in Canada.
Dreyfuss was only 30 when he first won the Oscar for Best Actor.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dreyfuss never appeared in a movie set in Canada.

questions.question: In 1981 Richard Dreyfuss starred in Whose Life Is It Anyway?. Which actress was  famous for starring in the Broadway version?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mary Tyler Moore

questions.question: Which statement about Richard Dreyfuss is false?

options.text: Dreyfus is a Civil War enactor.
Richard Dreyfuss says the line This is no boating accident.
Dreyfus is the only major actor to appear in films by both Spielberg and George Lucas.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dreyfus is the only major actor to appear in films by both Spielberg and George Lucas.

questions.question: In what Neil Simon movie did Richard Dreyfuss appear in 1977?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Goodbye Girl

questions.question: He was born January 26, 1925 and is the oldest of these four actors.

questions.question: He is open about his membership in the Libertarian party and has said that he has a lot in common with Michael Moore. Both want to be given the opportunity to live in America free, but he says if Michael shows up on his doorstep with a camera, he will kill him.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Clint Eastwood

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mary Travers

questions.question: This actress who passed away in 2009, starred on the hit television show Maude.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bea Arthur

questions.question: This famous boxer died in July of 2009.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Arturo Gatti

questions.question: He was born March 24th, 1930.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Steve McQueen

questions.question: This former famous wrestling manager died in 2009.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Capt. Lou Albano

questions.question: This actor who died in 2009 is best known for co-starring in Burt Reynolds movies in the 70s and 80s.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dom DeLuise

questions.question: This famous news reporter died at the age of 92 in July of 2009.

questions.question: This former pornographic actress died in April of 2009.

A blond girl he then had a crush on
